titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A warm & brilliant day, though with a cold wind. I worked at my preparation for tomorrow both in the morning & in the evening. This with my letters occupied about 7 hours.

Ella and I walked to Binchester Farm, & left cards on the Thompsons who were not at home: being in fact in Newcastle attending a great gathering of Conservatives, and listening to Winston Churchill. Lady Eden & Fearne attended the same meeting.
